Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nikki T
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and its location! Just a few steps from the metro and in a lovely neighborhood. The rooms are clean and the decor is lovely. The hotel was the perfect size and didn't feel touristy at all, as a matter of fact I rarely saw or heard other residents. The staff was outstanding and helpful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Service is hit and miss i.e. true Parisian style, but the cost performance is EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: hikkirocks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 4 hotels in Paris during my visit to Paris with my mother, 3 of which were within the same price range, and I've gotta say Hotel De l'Empereur was simply the BEST value. Pros: Room- Romantic Room with Garden View was perfect especially considering the price. The view was lovely, the room was quite spacious, and the bathroom was very modern and stylish with all the amenities i.e. shampoo etc. Location- In a rather posh (albeit lacking character) area near the Eiffel Tower. Walking distance to the cafes, the local supermarket, and of course the metro. Cons: Service was very hit and miss. The day-time receptionist woman really gives you the impression that she can't be bothered, but hey, she got the job done. Some staff were better than others. Internet- it's my fault really, as I didn't realise I had to leave the web browser tab of the log-in page OPEN while I use the net. Confusing nonetheless. The PC provided at reception was very slow, but the night staff was kind enough to make a phone call to the sister hotel across the street, just so I could use their printer. Overall I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NinaPasz
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from the main attractions in Paris. Just 10 minutes away from Eiffel Tower. Very good tube connections to anywhere in Paris. I am not sure why this hotel has been rated as 2*. The quality of the rooms is certainly at 4* level and the price per room/per night matches 3* average. Possibly because it is small hotel that has no room service, no restaurant and no minibar/fittness club, etc. But who cares when you are in Paris. After a busy sightseeing day, you just collapse on your bed with exhaustion and rest until next busy day. The room is comfortable and it has surprisingly large bathroom with lovely big shower. The room itself is smallish but it is in line with Paris common standard. It is located near some lovely restaurants offering variety of cuisines; french, moroccan, italian. The reception team is extremely helpful and acts as concierge with useful hints and tips for moving around Paris. Breakfast Lady was very attentive and we loved our croissants with coffee. Highly recommended for couples. Families may find it too small and the stairs too steep (tiny elevator also available).

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic in every way. The rooms are amazing, clean, tidy and spacious. If you’re lucky enough you will get a mind blowing view of Les invalides from your balcony. Trust me you’ll be hard pushed to find any other hotel as good as this for the price you pay. The hotel is in a superb location, it’s in walking distance from the Eiffel tower and you can access all from Paris easily from la Tour Maubourg metro stop which is just around the corner. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. If you book this you won’t go wrong and you will have a truly Parisian experience - enjoy!! During your stay I would also recommend that you try the restaurant opposite as the food is delicious, it has a great ambiance and it’s very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ttennison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de l'Emereur for 7 nights in late Sept, 2011. We had a great stay; clean & very quiet. The room had a fantastic view of Les Invalides, at which we gazed every night before going to bed. The air conditioning worked wonderfully. Be sure to turn the thermostat lower than you are accustomed. The shower is very different. Really no door to keep the water off the floor, but plenty of hot water. Very good location. Walking distance for a lot of sights. The hotel staff, except one person, was excellent. Remi, Hakim, & Kessi were all very helpful in every regard and spoke English very well. We did not take breakfast at the hotel, as the hotel is very close to Rue Cler. We ate breakfast on Rue Cler where one restaurant had 2 for 12 Euro breakfasts, which was one of the most reasonable breakfasts we found. It was not big; one egg, croissant, coffee or tea, juice. It still beat most breakfasts in France. Lobby did have a computer for use by guests, but it can be a long wait if your timing is not right. My husband loves coffee and is not a particular fan of Starbucks, but he did visit a Starbucks at the end of Rue Cler just so he could get more than 2 oz. of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Greg D
Reviews.Content: My wife and came to Paris for 5 days in March 2012 for her 50th birthday. I asked for flowers in the room when we arrived and there was a huge, beautiful bouquet in a lovely crystal vase accompanied by a bottle of champagne on ice with two champagne flutes. I did not request the champagne, so that was a wonderful surprise, and an indication of the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff at Hotel de l'Empereur. Every day we spent here was a pleasure. Room was not cavernous, but a comfortable size. Bed was very comfortable, plenty of pillows, quality linens. Bathroom was large by Parisian standards, and the heated towel rack and mirror were a nice touch. The toilet was in a separate room from the shower/sink, which was nice. The free wireless internet was speedy, and they will give you as many logins as you have devices (we happened to have an iPhone, an iPad, and two laptops, which was no problem). Perfect location on the left bank. Across the street from Les Invalides/Napoleon's Tomb, and walking distance to La Tour Eiffel, Musee Orsay, Musee Rodin, Boulevard St. Germain, the Grand Palais, Petit Palais, Champs Elysees, and the Louvre. If you like walking in Paris (and who doesn't?), Notre Dame is also in range. Staff was always exceedingly helpful with recommendations for places to eat, calling a taxi, directions to places of interest - it was just a wonderful experience from the moment we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: What a great little Hotel. This hotel was very clean, the staff was quite friendly and helpful, and it was about 50 yards to a Metro stop. We were completely satisfied with this place and it will be our headquarters when we return. The shower was nice and the bed very comfortable. The towells were plush and kept warm due to the electric towell rack. It is in a quiet, safe neighborhood close to nice shops and restaurants and within walking distance to the Eiffle tower, Rodin museum, Napeleon's tomb and much more. It is also right around the corner from an "Open Tour" stop. I really loved this place and cannot imagine finding a better place for the price. Finally, get to know the staff, especially Remy. He was so kind and helpful to us and made us feel welcomed and special. We loved this place and cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: SQ452
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here back in January during my solo trip to Paris and points elsewhere. After spending probably hours online (and on this site) trying to find the perfect place to stay in Paris, I settled on Hotel de l'Empereur. While it is a "bit off the beaten path" it is situated in an absolutely gorgeous part of Paris: next to Les Invalides, a short stroll from some cafes and the busier side of Paris near the Eiffel Tower. There is also a metro stop nearby making this 'walking city' a little more convenient to get around. The price was also very reasonable for Paris and I found it of good value. I arrived super early on a Saturday morning. Room was as expected not ready but was able to lock up the luggage in storage. Off to get a quick breakfast and do some more walking around then! Once I was able to check in, I really feel I lucked out. As a single traveler, I even had a great room on the second floor facing Les Invalides. The room and bathroom are small and tiny but so goes most of the hotels in Paris. For the price I paid I was quite happy though. The room was beautifully decorated; they must have renovated recently. Bathroom was clean and so was the room. Bed was comfy as well. The hotel is also 100% non-smoking which is GREAT for a non-smoker like me. But on a number of occasions, there was a smell of smoke that drifted up the stairwell from the lobby which I could smell in my room. I suspected it was people that actually stepped outside for a smoke and the smell just drifted in the front door, or, there was someone smoking elsewhere in the hotel either in another room or down in the lobby in a backroom or something. . .these were just theories I had but I couldn't find the source ultimately. This wasn't much of a huge issue. I did run into Catherine, the owner of the hotel/manager and mentioned it to her and she did take it quite seriously and after that encounter, never had an issue with the smoke again. Catherine was also most helpful and pleasant; she even helped out in an unfortunate situation as I was stuck with a 500 Euro note (money changer had given me one at my departure point) which is virtually impossible to get rid of in Paris short of going to a bank which, if you don't have an account with they won't break into smaller notes. Fortunately she came to the rescue. She runs a fine establishment and most all her staff is for pleasant and attentive. I would highly recommend this place: it is a quality establishment and has a great location (great restaurant next door). It may be away from some of the major sites but in all actuality you are not far from much in Paris. I look forward to returning one day and wish this hotel continued success.

Reviews.Title: “Small but plush rooms, with a stellar location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda F
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel de l'Empereur in early March, and found the location extremely convenient. We had a stunning view from our window of the dome of Napoleon's Tomb, and could easily walk to that and many other sights -- Musee Rodin, the Eiffel Tower, the Orangerie, etc -- as well as several metro stations, yet it was a fairly quiet neighborhood. We had an outstanding dinner just a few steps away at the restaurant Pasco, as well as a lovely breakfast at Pain et Chocolat just around the corner (on Ave La Motte Picquet). The room was small; not much larger than the bed, but very comfortable, with a great shower and heated towel rack in the bathroom. Only complaints: The plastic mattress pad beneath the sheets, which made sleeping quite sweaty until we figured out how to turn off the heat in the room, and the fact that the "double" bed was actually two twin mattresses pushed together -- but this was not the only place in France we encountered either of those things. Free wifi access was a big plus, although only one of our devices could use the password at a time, and the room price was quite reasonable at 135 euros a night (off-season weekdays).

Reviews.Title: “Right next to Napoleon's Tomb”
Reviews.Author: Continent8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our European Auto tour. The small hotel was very clean, quiet, friendly, and was only about two blocks from the subway. You could see the gold dome of Napoleon's tomb right outside our window and were only about 10 or so minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood is quieter here than St. Germain so if you want to comb through 200 t-shirt shops within a block of your door this is not the place for you. This is a more refined neighborhood and you feel very safe here. Our bathroom was very nice and new and put together with very expensive materials. Excellent neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Center walking distance to Eiffel tower and excellent view to Dom des Invalides”
Reviews.Author: sauraumpfa
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 days on a business trip, the rooms on the 6th floor where very nice with a view towards the "dom des invalids" - very difficult to find at that price level in Paris. rooms are spacious for paris standards and beds are very comfortable, with electronic save, a flat screen TV and a small writing desk, the bathrooms are newly refurbished in a modern black design, inclusive hair dryer, wall mounted heated towel rail, large mirrors and modern square rain showerhead. WIFI is free of charge! the hotel reception was very friendly especially the guy on night duty (algerian origin). the elevator is quite narrow as usual in paris. the location of the hotel is very good, you reach Eiffel tower in a view minutes, Rue Cler (many restaurants and cafes) as well and metro station is around the corner ("la tour maubourg"). take the nr. 8 line and you will reach most places of interest. i would recommend to buy a ticket for a day - it´s cost is just 9, 5 € (you can use all metro and bus within paris for 24 hrs) we didn´t take breakfast in the hotel bcs. there are many small cafes in the vicinity - breakfast is usually around 13 - 17 € (eggs, ham, cheese, croissant, coffee and fresh orange juice) this hotel provides super value for money - noise level is very low and we slept perfectly fine all 3 days (aprox. 135 €/day).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kusabi
Reviews.Content: the hotel is clean, bathroom with shower nice, room size sufficient...good value for your money. the location is very good...walking distance from Eiffel tower. breakfast is simple, but sufficient. we had one room with view for two - nice one, but small, and second was single room - two times bigger, but without view. We can recommend the hotel. Enjoy! I am pretty sure we will return to this one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: A cold week in February but a warm, welcoming hotel. Newly decorated, large, modern bathroom with heated towel racks; cozy, clean bedroom. Hotel will hold luggage while waiting for room if you arrive early - no charge. Elevator small but holds two people w/luggage. Great staff night and day went out of their way to help, including finding restaurants and printing boarding passes. Breakfast selection and preparation excellent, not just limited to continental breakfast. Location perfect for Metro and walking. Enjoyed Rue Cler close by for shopping, meals and French life. Many good restaurants and shopping in other nearby areas as well. Walk to Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides and Musee Rodin. Would defninitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteWahoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late November and really enjoyed our stay. We would recommend this hotel based on the value for money and location alone. It has been recently renovated and the rooms are finished to a very high standard. We had a room with a view of Les Invalides and enjoyed staying near Rue Cler. Eiffel Tower is close by. The staff could be friendlier, although we don't have any specific complaints. Would highly recommend this hotel as long as the price stays reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: candjsmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything. Shops, restaurants, sites and the metro. Rue Cler is a fabulous street not to far from the hotel with lots to offer in the way of Parisian lifestyle. Beautifully decorated rooms which although they are petit, are very comfortable. Everything is newly decorated and renovated. I would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: Maygrove172
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with very young children (5, 3, 5 months). The suite of connected rooms on the 6th floor was perfect. Baby cot provided, very clean and wonderful decor. The view onto les Invalides was stunning. We did not try breakfast but the cafes and brasseries within a short walk are perfect for little children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fordred89
Reviews.Content: Went here for Valentines Day. Was not disappointed! Excellent room, loved the shower and bathroom. Make sure you get a room with a view of the dome. Excellent service by reception, be sure to ask them for a good restaurant. Things that I didn't like were the Wi-Fi (only one device could use it at a time, but the connection was quick and not congested unlike other hotels) and the "Do Not Disturb" thing didn't work on the door. Also, the free toiletries only include shampoo and body wash. No toothbrush, toothpaste or moisturiser.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view from a beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: LAD_y1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in the hotel de l'empereur in early feb and the room was amazing. Paid extra for the room with a view and it was lovely to look out at the invalides in the morning and evening. A couple of blocks from the Eiffel Tower (5min walk).The room itself was a relatively small but this is normal for Paris, very comfortable double bed and beautiful decor. Shower had a large overhead mechanism, free shampoo and soap, bed made / towels changed daily. Very friendly staff who offered advice as to where to eat. Paris overall very expensive, £10 euros avg for a beer, but we were prepared so wasn't a huge shock! Would definitely recommend this hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “We went back and we loved it !”
Reviews.Author: LeoOlgaAna
Reviews.Content: We return at this hotel in the new year´s eve and everything was perfect. We were five families, and everything was perfect. We were very well received, during all the 5 days that we were there. Once again, thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: DCRunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: What a classy hotel! Makes you feel like you're in a Grace Kelly or Audrey Hepburn movie. Lovely boutique feel - nice furnishings, high end facilities, very clean, loads of character, and perfect location and view. It is truly the Paris that you imagine. Hotel staff mostly spoke English, but not everyone (especially the night staff) spoke it well. We had an amazing experience and cannot recommend it highly enough. Take advantage of the location and eat on Rue Cler as much as possible! We loved Central and Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, clean, and check the view!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBingham
Reviews.Content: I splurged for this hotel because my mother was with me and she's 60 and unsure in a foreign country. She absolutely melted when she saw our room with a view towards Hotel Invalides! It was priceless. We arrived from Gard du Nord by taxi (roughly 40 euros) and it was early morning but our room happened to be open so we were able to check in. As for the comments about staff, if you are polite, they are polite. We had no troubles. The beds were fabulous, the furnishings beautiful, and the view is just lovely. On our last night before going home, we turned out the lights and stared at the dome while talking about our trip... I will always remember that. P.S. Pasco restaurant across the street is yummy for dinner. Open after 7:30 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little bolt-hole in the seventh, which is actually a really great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Henry_B
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the tip, TripAdvisor. Yes it was a small room - they are ALL small in Paris unless you have big coin! - but exquisitely styled and immaculate. We had a room on a corner of the hotel and pinched ourselves with joy at the beautiful view across the street to the glorious golden dome of Les Invalides. We opened that window to lean out and take in the view several times a day. The hotel itself also had quite a charming frontage adorned with brightly flowering cyclamens. The builtin wardrobe in the room seemed small but was big enough to pack away two suitcases of clothing as well as the cases, so the room wasn't cluttered. There was also a small desk where we had no problems using the wifi. The bathroom was very modern, also with a window (privacy blind) and heated towel rack. The hotel has one of those classic miniature lifts you get in all these old buildings in Europe - tiny but functional. The bed had plenty of pillows but was too soft for my back, and a waterproof liner on the mattress made it a tad sweaty at times. The room was immaculately cleaned each day. It was winter but the heating was excellent. There's no minibar and you aren't allowed to eat in your room (I didn't see this notice until the second or third day but hadn't been "reported" by the housekeeping staff for all the chocolate papers they must have found in the bin!) and it does breakfast but not dinner; however there are heaps of brasseries, pizza joints and restaurants in this area and if you walk 2 mins to the other end of the street which the hotel is on the corner of, there is a pretty good kebab shop. There's a small vending machine in reception for soft drinks and water but you're better off visiting one of the nearby supermarkets or convenience stores. The location was wonderful. The seventh is a very relaxed semi-residential area full of classical French apartment buildings. Real estate window shopping showed us you can easily pay a million or more for a decent sized apartment round here, and the shops reflect a comparable quality of life and gourmet tastes. In the evenings it is amazing how many dogs pop out of the apartments with their owners! The hotel is handy enough to metro stops to use these for arrival and departure transport, either pulling a suitcase or carrying a backpack, and for touristy day trips it's also easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine, Batobus stops, Place de la Concorde, and of course Les Invalides is right there. When we made our hotel booking (through a booking site) the hotel responded quickly with some useful tips for tourists, including an airport shuttle which we did book and which was very worthwhile for our arrival trip. The breakfast of 11Euro each is actually very good value (just check the board at any brasserie to compare!). You get a continental buffet - so baguettes, croissants, pain du chocolat, hot coffee, chocolate, tea, ham and cold meats, cheeses, butter and jams, toast, cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit salad, fruit, and even boiled eggs - plenty to choose from and take your time to fuel up for the day ahead. Staff were pretty friendly - notably the housekeeping, who we ran into once or twice. Front desk staff were mostly very helpful as were the breakfast room staff - we just found it a little odd it is seemingly still ok to smoke in the kitchen, and stray fumes were a little offputting at breakfast. But that's France for you.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: enghien
Reviews.Content: I last stayed here 3 years or so ago and used it for about 15 years before that, off and on, but it is better than ever! The location has not improved (it is still in the same wonderful spot!), but the rooms and hallways are all updated and very nicely done. I chose one of the larger rooms, which was quite and comfortable. A reasonable rate, delightful location and welcoming receptionists. Highly recommended, in a field of many choices in Paris (and in the 7th arrondisement).

Reviews.Title: “A Few Days in Paris Jan.2012”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth T
Reviews.Content: My daughters booked our Hotel as it was a present for my 70th birthday. Very good choice too. My hubby & I stayed in room 54,which had a balcony view of L'Invalides.The room was spacious & clean.The staff were very helpful.Especially Remee. We ate in the Rue Cler just a short walk away. Could've done with tea making machine/kettle & a bar in the hotel. Otherwise Hotel Central to all tourist attractions.The Eiffel Tower being the nearest.I was also spoiled by my daughter with a ticket to the Moulin Rouge & an illuminated trip in mini-bus round Paris.Both were ecellent & I can recommend all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor service, rooms/location good”
Reviews.Author: aonzo
Reviews.Content: I’ve just come back from my Paris holiday. As reviews have said before, the location/bed room were good, I was just disappointed by the room size/ staff. The thing that shocked me the most was the staff, they were not at all welcoming/ understanding. The first minute I walk in the hotel, I get blanked by the receptionist. Only to be welcomed with the following words “put the luggage in the room next to the entrance”…we then left the hotel to visit Paris for the day. By the way, we used their site to do the booking. That night, when we came back we were dealt with by a male receptionist for the check in…only to be accused of being a thief. While the booking was confirmed on the website my credit card had initially had not been accepted. He tells me that I was lucky as they would normally cancel the booking because of the decline. We didn’t fully understand what he was telling us as we had received an email with our payment going through and had put our correct mobile/email contact numbers if they needed to contact us. The night staff then insists that I pay the full amount for the stay upfront…which of course I declined and said I would pay only once we check out (I let him take a small amount on my card to prove it worked…) As previously mentioned I was disappointed by the size of the room, so the following morning I went to the reception desk to try and discuss the matter. I landed on the same receptionist from the previous day in the morning that I had first met at the hotel…once again the lady was rude and not welcoming at all! I was bluntly told by the lady, that she did not care that if I was not impressed with the rooms and that if I was not happy that I could go elsewhere. I asked to speak to the manager of the hotel and was told “Well, she’s on holiday!". I then requested the contact details of the manger so I could leave a message and was just instructed to us their main email (contact@.. Etc) To conclude, the location was nice but the staff were very rude and the rooms were probably a bit too small. The mentioned experiences nearly ruined my girlfriend’s weekend holiday. Next time I go to Paris I will not use the hotel. Very very poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms, good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: AgiCac
Reviews.Content: Really good location, within walking distance of most attractions. Room was clean, with nice bathroom. Only negative is having to pay for tea/coffee as no facilities in room and no bar in the hotel. Will stay here again if we go back to Paris. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zafera82
Reviews.Content: Great, clean hotel in a perfect location. The metro was literally like a 3 minute walk and there were plenty of shops, bakeries and a grocery store in the area. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel since there was a great bakery nearby. The rooms were plenty big and very clean. The staff was great and helped with our every need. The only issue was the wi-fi connection. Granted it was free but it was very slow and since it was Christmas we tried to Skype with our family but it just kept on dropping the line. But other than that, I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept secret until now!”
Reviews.Author: Chillipeppa
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly impressed with this hotel, particularly as in Paris (like London and many older European cities) hotel rooms are small and cramped. When newly decorated, they are usually in boring corporate colours. This little gem shouts Versace when its superbly co-ordinated carpets, drapes and walls are in perfect rich black and gold harmony. I understand the other rooms have similar themes. I asked for a single room and as per previous Parisian visits I expected just that, a single bed with a tiny bathroom doubling as a closet. Can you imagine my surprise and bliss to be presented with an enormous king size bed, a huge bathroom and separate hallway and closet. Flat screen TV of big proportions on the wall complete the creature comforts. There are some really nice restaurants in the neighbourhood, most within a short walk. Taxi rank is 50 metres away, so is a metro station. This hotel is beautifully central, museums, Eiffel Tower all within a short walk away. And for all you English speakers out there who complain that Parisians are unfriendly and do not try to communicate in English, the hotel staff are almost all very fluent in English, are very helpful in arranging tours, explaining how the Metro and RER rail systems work etc. I felt so welcome in Paris for the first time ever and it is entirely due to the wonderful staff who tried so hard to please us in every way. The breakfast offered as an "extra" was really excellent. Bottomless coffee, juices and almost everything, fresh croissants and French bread from a local bakery - more than enough to last well into the day. Finally, when one finds a little gem like this, one is so tempted to keep the info all to one's self, so that it will always be available when one needs it, but indeed this would be selfish of me. I hope all of you that read this will enjoy room 21 as much as i did. It had no view, but I don't need a view when I sleep. My business colleague was in room 54, very nice he said, with a view and a small balcony

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: MeganM76
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my second trip to Paris and we decided to stay a bit more central this time around. The Hotel de l’Empereur is right next to the Hotel de Invalides and a short walk to the Eifel Tower. What a lovely hotel! We were in Room 11 which was the first room off the stairs from the lobby, but were never bothered by noise. The rooms were on the small side (to be expected) but were obviously recently renovated with beautiful décor, lovely, comfortbale bedding and a flat screen tv (although every station by CNN International is in French :)). The bathroom even put American hotel bathrooms to shame with its size, marble floors and walls and a waterfall shower to boot. The rooms were all super clean and tidy as was the hotel lobby. The staff was friendly although we didn’t have too much interaction with them other than leaving our key every morning. As an FYI, the breakfast is 11 euro which we didn’t realize the first day (but quickly did after they asked for our room number!) so just be aware. Overall an excellent choice for your stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: BigTreeLover
Reviews.Content: Perfect for me - inexpensive, quiet neighborhood, convenient to dining (Pasco across the street), Metro, grocery and cafes. Walk to the Eiffel Tower. My single was a nice size, the bathroom was huge, and everything was new. The bed and pillows were great. All of the cable channels are in French and if that doesn't work for you bring something to watch!

Reviews.Title: “A star in the City of Light”
Reviews.Author: KRGreenBay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in October, 2011. Hotel de I'Empereur is in a great location with easy access to the Eiffel Tower, other sights, dining and the metro. We walked to Rue Cler daily to enjoy the bakeries and cafes. The English speaking hotel staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions. We had a "romantic room with a view of the courtyard". There was no view other than the scaffolding set up for construction work on the neighboring building (we never saw any work being doen while we were there). The view was not a big concern for us so it wasn't an issue. We kept the window open and there was a lot of noise coming from the kitchen below, but we're early risers so it wasn't a major problem for us. The room itself was very nice as was the bathroom. The bathroom was next to the door and a hallway led to the rest of the room, giving it a larger feel. I don't think all rooms were this size, but we had a room that was right at the top of the stairs. The linens and bedding were all plush and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stevemexico
Reviews.Content: just returned from paris two weeks ago.this hotel was clean,efficient, and friendly.the location was in rue cler and within walking distance of the tower,river,and many other locations.the room was bright,airy,clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room and View”
Reviews.Author: annahat
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a 2-night stay at this hotel and was very pleasantly surprised at the excellent value for money with the following nice touches: 1. A beautifully decorated room with a beautiful view. 2. A very comfortable bed with cozy linens -- I hated to get out of bed! 3. A well- lighted bathroom with an elegant marble decor. The big surprise was the towel warmer! Another small but gratifying detail was the facial tissue dispenser. 4. The desk area had outlets at table level for easy plug in and recharging of laptop and other electronics. 5. The night manager Hakim was very helpful and concerned for my comfort. On the service side,I would make two small suggestions that I would make to all hotels: 1) It would be a nice touch to ask guests on check-in if they will need WiFi access and then generate the password immediately for them if a password is required. I had to get re-dressed and come to the desk to get mine. 2. Ask guests if they would like help in making arrangements for departure to an airport -- I realize that this is my responsibility but it would have been a helpful reminder and I think would be much appreciated by most guests.. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: pulitzer
Reviews.Content: Small but modern rooms, excellent staff, great location

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Larla13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so happy with our choice of this hotel! We had an amazing view of Invalides from our window which made it all the more special. The room had plenty of space for a hotel in Paris and was beautifully decorated. This was one of the few hotels we stayed in during our trip to France where we didn't have trouble with the wifi which was important since we didn't take phones. The staff was friendly enough. The location was great. The neighborhood didn't feel too tourist-y and was close to great cafes and several metro stops. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: blackhawk55
Reviews.Content: We were generally quite pleased with the Hotel de l'Empereur, located on a quite street near Invalides. The staff (especially Hakim and Remy) were friendly, helpful and competent. Our room was clean and roomy. We would give an excellent rating except for some minor complaints with the wifi, and some construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nicely refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: Pinpollito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Eiffel Tower, but in a quiet street. Some rooms have a view of the golden dome of Invalides. Not ours, which was an attic room overlooking the courtyard. The hotel has been recently refurbished and our room was very nice, and a bit quirky. Not bad for the price we paid (€300 for two nights). Only downsides were: uninspiring breakfast, and phone call at 11:05 am the day of check-out (I guess to remind us that we had to leave - we were heading out of the door and didn't answer, but it left a bit of a sour taste...)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dominique J
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough wonderful things about the two front desk folks, Remy and Hakim, they are both outstanding. The rooms are nicely appointed, the hotel is close to everything. The wi-fi is a bit quirky, but it was at every hotel I went to in France, so appears to be the norm.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Quality at Motel Prices (yeah, I said it!)”
Reviews.Author: warren1919
Reviews.Content: After wandering around a sweltering Paris for the better part of three hours, too weary to continue, and far too lost to be able to locate the hostel I was looking for, I broke down and wandered into this place. Mind you, this was in the summer of 2003, but the reception person took one look at me and seemed to have pity, and let me have a room for roughly $120 (US). The bed was a mammoth, cloud-like wasteland from which I very nearly didn't return. The bathroom had a ceiling-mount shower head that had that delicious raindrop effect. I swear before all that is holy that it was the greatest shower experience of my life. Perfectly located in the middle of all that is wonderful in Paris, it doesn't get much better than this for the price. A quiet, cozy, reasonably priced wonderland in the middle of one of the world's most outstanding cities. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated hotel in fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: A wonderful 5 night stay in Hotel De L'Empereur made for a lovely introduction to Paris during my first trip to France. This Hotel will service your needs for an inner city stay, located only 1 minute away from 'La Tour Mauborg' metro station and directly opposite the Invalides. A short 5-10min walk from La Tour D'Eiffel and a 2min walk from the charming Rue Cler - a lively street market and dining hub. The hotel has been recently renovated with a large bathroom and fantastic shower. My room on the 4th floor also had an amazing view of the Invalides. Hotel staff speak multiple languages and are friendly and unintrusive. The only cons I can think of are the lack of tea/coffee facilites and tour booking options. Though this is not a major imposition given the abundance of cafe's and tourist facilities nearby. Overall: a highly recommended stay for anyone visiting Paris and looking to be close to the action in a quiet and classy area.

Reviews.Title: “AN ENCHANTING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gypsy49
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Remy on reception our welcome was perfect. We found this hotel very charming, the decor and ambiance very French. A great location, one gets the feeling of mingling with the locals of the area, not too touristy, however the Eiffel Tower is a 20 minute walk. Saturday morning we wandered around the stalls on the street market just around the corner before leaving for the train station. A lovely way to finish our stay. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miraong
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with our stay here. Clean room, comfortable beds, and it has a lift (small). Very near a metro, and you will appreciate that metro stop after walking all over Paris. Pasco Restaurant is just across the street. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: Cathy W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here Sept. 8-12, 2011. We loved this hotel for many reasons: It had recently been renovated and the rooms were very, very nice. Beds, baths and A/C were all great, and spotlessly clean. Very nice breakfast, too. But the best part of this Hotel is the gracious and friendly service provided by both Remy and Hakim, both of whom speak excellent English. Remy helped us with a medical need by suggesting we start with a Pharmacist nearby, who could recommend a Doctor. At check-out, Hakim made sure our taxi to CDG was waiting at 6:10 am Monday morning, that we got wake-up calls (the 2nd call to make sure we were up) and that our coffee was waiting for us prior to leaving, even though breakfast doesn't start until 7:00. These two gentlemen make this hotel very, very special, as they truly care about each and every guest. We were very impressed and will stay here again! Merci, Remy and Hakim! We also loved the Rue Cler/Rue de la Motte Piquet neighborhood. It is very "livable" with grocery store, laundry, dry cleaners, pharmacies and doctors, etc. We patronized them all and everyone was very friendly and helpful. There were also many nice restaurants and shops we patronized when not sight-seeing. The hotel is well-located one short block from Metro station La Tour Marbourg, right across from the Invalides. We booked a room with a beautiful view of Les Invalides' majestic dome and it was breathtaking both day and night. In short, we recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “WOW-loved it! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: pjfarkel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 17 days in Europe with my 16 yr old grandson (I'm the grandma). London, Liverpool, Amsterdam & Pairs. Paris-what can I say-absolutely enchanting. My 3rd visit, his 1st. Our room was called Twin room - Romantic with shower-View of Les Invalides and what a view! We opened the drapes and there was Napoleon's Tomb gold dome extravaganza staring back at us in all its glory-just fabulous! I couldn't stare at it enough. Now, back to the room-I would call it "quirky" and "interesting." There was a safe in the closet-very handy and appreciated. The beds were extremely comfortable-a top priority of mine. Flat screen TV, also a nice touch. It was beautifully decorated and here is the quirky part. There was a door/tiny room with only a toilet in it. Hum, no sink, no fan, no soundproofing-I am sure you understand what I am saying. We made a deal that if someone went into the toilet, the TV went on. The shower which was black marble, a huge rain shower head, big and beautiful was in another area off the bedroom...and no door! Quirky, definitely. There was a heavy duty black-out drape across the doorway. It did match the drapes across the windows...but one could hear everything going on in the shower/sink area. Funky, yes. The prettiness of the room and beauty of the restroom did outweigh the awkwardness of sharing with my grandson. We managed. The location was perfect. We used the metro, just down the block La Tour Maurbourg or sometime Ecole Militarie. Great restaurants all around the area and a nice grocery store too. The front desk personnel were accommodating, knowledgeable, and very nice. The Free Wi-Fi worked most of the time. Would have to log-on several times though. A little annoying, but not that big a problem. I did use the lobby computer to print my boarding passes-this worked fine once I understood the keyboard. Would I stay here again - most definitely. Would I recommend this to my friends and family-absolutely. It is a real find and I love this area. We walked to the Eiffel Tower-easy and felt safe at night. The hop-on/off bus is located just in front of Les Invalides, so easy to use too. Stay here-you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly - "we loved and we'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: aartemyev
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there just for a week but we loved the place, the ambiance and the staff. The refined taste of the hotelier emanates everywhere: the rooms' decor and design, the ingenius choice of the curtains, the comfortable classic furniture. The beds were refreshingly white and clean, the bed-linen was of very good quality. The ambiance of the breakfast (only 11 euros extra) with almost nobody bothering you was syntonizing the home. The staff was very friendly, helpful and unobtrusive. The location is great - the rue Chevert is quiet and takes you straight to avenue La Motte-Piquet that brings you to Champs de Mars and Eiffel Tower. All that creates the ambient atmosphere for guests, light and refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “We found a gem in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris k
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for my parents' 50th anniversary and stayed 5 nights at Hotel de L'Empereur. Hakim and Remy who were the hotel's guest service representatives were great. We had Remy during the morning and afternoons while Hakim worked the evenings. They both made me and my family feel welcomed and comfortable throughout the stay. The rooms are much bigger than most Europeans hotels but still may feek a bit small for some. I can tell you the value of the hotel was realized very quickly when you looked at the size of your rooms, the cleanliness of the hotel and the sincere desire to make your trip memorable. The area we stayed was a bit away from some of the major sites but that was not a big deal since you could travel the Metro which was right near the hotel. In fact some of the other areas were somewhat dirty and contained graffiti so we felt more relaxed and at times safer at our hotel. Within a very short distance we found a small grocery store (opened to 10pm) to purchase wine (bottles of wine around 4 euros or less) and cheese (sampled many different varieties with crackers) which we ate as a family every evening in the downstairs dining area. There is no eating in the rooms which at first was a little different but then you quickly realize it is a policy in place to maintain the quaility of the sleeping quarters. No one wants stains on the carpet or other areas of their room. There are also a few small cafe and restaurants within walking distance to eat all of the meals. Can not remember the name of one which was not worth going to (believe it was La Costa or something similiar it had red awnings); had bad food and prices were high, will try to review that later. Walking distance to Napolean's Museum, Effeil Tower and a few other areas but again took the Metro to most places. Also be prepared to walk a lot unless you are going to just relax at cafe' all day long. Averaged roughly 10 -12 miles per day of walking when all was said and done. Thanks again to the managment of Hotel de L'Empereur, as well as Remy and Hakim for a excellent time in Paris. My family are grateful for your hospitality and willingness to help us with every aspect of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaulme
Reviews.Content: Located in the 7th arrondissement, near Les Invalides complex, and close to three Metro stations, L'Emperpeur is a perfect city hotel with an amazing, friendly and helpful staff. It is near Rue Cler with several restaurants and shops. Restaurant Pasco is just across the street. WiFi throughout the hotel and a computer in the hotel lobby added greatly to the overall appeal especially for my teenage granddaughter. It is within easy walking distance to the Eiffel tower, Champs de Mars, Napolean's tomb, Rodin Museum and the Paris Sewer Tour. Hotel room very clean with extremely cozy, comfortable beds and modern marble bathroom. Wish I was still there and would return for a stay in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, large triple rooms”
Reviews.Author: Letsgo5_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris in the afternoon and was greeted by name by Remi. Remi was very courteous and extremely helpful. He gave us a map and answered all of our questions and gave us extra information that he thought would be helpful. First about the hotel: our 3 teens stayed in a triple and we had a double with a view. The triple was a large room facing the courtyard. The double was small as we had expected from previous reviews - but the view of the Invalides was incredible. Sometime during the first night the a/c broke down. We told Remi about it the next morning on our way out. Because of the weekend the a/c could not be repaired until Monday but we had two choices: another room with a view or a courtyard facing room. The courtyard room was really a triple and it was huge for just the two of us as was the bathroom. Unheard of in Paris! We were delighted with the switch and have no complaints. We didn't mind not having the view as we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel. Highlights of the hotel: Elegantly designed rooms Clean rooms and bathrooms Bathrooms very well ventilated Rain and hand held shower heads Comfortable beds and pillows a/c works great small elevator front desk staff friendly and helpful close to Metro close to cafes quiet area at night free WiFi room safe We would stay at L'Empereur again. It was really difficult finding a triple in Paris, much less on short notice and the price was very reasonable. The rooms we had were lovely and large as were the modern bathrooms. The hotel is very clean and all the rooms have been recently renovated. Remi and Hakim are very helpful and make you feel like you are their special guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful staff...I can't say anything bad about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tulipgirl74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first 4 days of our honeymoon and it was perfect. We were on the 3rd floor and look at the dome of the Invalades from our window. It is within 2 blocks of a Metro station, close to Rue Cler, and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The room was small for American standards, but the bed was deliciously comfortable. The bathroom was good sized and suited us perfectly. The staff was helpful and did their best to help us practice our French, but spoke excellent English. I was especially impressed when we slept in the first day we were there until about 1 pm. We didn't leave the hotel until 1:30 or 2, and our room was still made up when we got back. That would RARELY happen in hotels in the US and really impressed us. They also fixed the only problem we had quickly and efficiently. Our shuttle to go to the airport didn't show. The man at the front desk gave us some suggestions on what we could do, and eventually called us a cab that got us to the airport in record time. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone considering going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful 2 star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Flatworld71
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that my husband and I have located a hotel through a Rick Steves' book. Based on our very pleasant experience at the Hotel de l�Empereur, I'll definitely have to check out his suggestions in the future. The hotel on Rue Chevert worked out beautifully for a 5-night stay in late June. Our room on the 3rd floor faced an internal courtyard, so it was quiet. Though the room was a bit small, it was perfectly adequate for the 2 of us, and the twin beds were quite comfortable. The TV was useful for catching up on the news through CNN�and the air conditioning worked beautifully. We were delighted with the bathroom, which appeared to have been recently remodeled. It was large and had a wonderful shower with both a handheld shower head and a conventional showerhead with excellent water pressure and HOT water. Breakfast was served in a small room on the first floor, and it was just fine for our needs--coffee, tea and juices, hard-boiled eggs, toast, rolls and pastries, yogurts, cereal, etc. We found members of the hotel staff to be very helpful, painstakingly mapping out the Metro/train route for us to take to the Paris Air Show, helping us with the phone system, and offering restaurant suggestions. We spoke virtually no French, but they were patient with us. We were pleased to find a BNP Paribas Bank located within a couple of blocks of the hotel, as I'd previously learned that it's a part of the Bank of America Global Alliance and would charge no ATM access fees to B of A customers. I still expected to have to pay a conversion fee, but no fees ever turned up on my bank statement. Loved it! We really appreciated the hotel's location--across the street from Les Invalides, a couple of blocks from the LaTour-Maubourg Metro stop, and close to lots of cafes and restaurants. We headed for the Rue Cler pedestrian area for dinner a couple of evenings. We were surprised to find so many Americans there, but it was still a delightful place to walk and enjoy the twilight. The Rodin Museum was only a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and the Eiffel Tower was about 10-12 minutes away. We were surprised to find that we could even walk to the Louvre. The wide, tree-lined streets made for really pleasant walks, and the area seemed much more peaceful than other neighborhoods in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, but not safe from intruders”
Reviews.Author: Ann K
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to be a little closer to the attractions in Paris that we wanted to see and to have a room with a/c since it was summer. It was a very nice room and although we didn't pay for a view, we got a room with a view of Hotel Invalides. The location was great, very close the metro, Rue Cler for breakfast, and about 15 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. I had read reviews of several hotels in Paris and remembered a different hotel that someone mentioned their room being broken into at night. So since our door didn't have a deadbolt lock, we put a suitcase under the handle so that it couldn't be turned down. Our very first night when we were jet-lagged, we woke up to the buzz of a key successfully unlocking our door and then someone tried the handle. However, we called out and they couldn't get the door open because of the suitcase. The hotel manager in the morning said it was the first time this had ever happened and gave us a new key. But we weren't satisfied with the excuses and explanations from her and other staff we spoke with. Every night after that we put our valuables in the room safe and moved our bed against the door so that it couldn't be opened. If it weren't for that, I'd give this hotel a great review because everything else about it was wonderful. I am sure this is common in lots of hotels but I think a simple solution would be to put dead bolt locks and chains on the room doors like hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, brilliant staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: rmajewska77
Reviews.Content: absolutely brilliant hotel, immaculate rooms and bathroom, very helpful staff, right in the centre of paris within the walking distance to all major attractions, would recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, New Boutique Hotel Near Big Tourist Sites”
Reviews.Author: ABroadAbroad
Reviews.Content: We needed a moderate, lovely, comfortable, air-conditioned hotel that had both double and triple rooms available within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Napoleon's Tomb: the Hotel de l'Empereur was exactly that. It's a newly renovated boutique hotel with Paris' typically tiny rooms and small lift, but the rooms are elegantly furnished (the overall look is one of sumptuousness, with reds and golds, heavy fabrics, luxurious padded headboards, etc) and the bathrooms are big and bright, with wonderful new showers that give you the option of hand-held or 'rainforest' sprays.The area is quiet at night, and there's double-glazing on the windows. Overall, I thought the hotel was excellent value for money. Our double, # 53, was very romantic, with a balcony and a stunning view of the gold dome of Les Invalides. The bed was the size of an American king or queen. There wasn't much space in the room itself for more than the bed-- a small desk, nightstands, and a closet were all that could fit -- but we slept wonderfully well. Our nephews shared a triple, #55, with three separate beds (two of which had been made from a double. The third was a roll-away bed, which, I must say, drew some complaints). Their room was much bigger than ours, with a view of the courtyard. If travelers need extra space, perhaps that line of rooms can be booked as doubles. The location itself is perfect for first-time tourists to Paris. We were there with nephews who'd never been to the city before, and so they wanted to take in all the big-name sites. Hotel de L'Empereur is within quick walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, the Seine cruises, Les Invalides, and the Grand and Petit Palais for art exhibitions. It's a minute from the market street of Rue Cler, 15 minutes from the Musee D'Orsay. It's a three-minute walk from the Metro and from a number of bus stops for lines that go straight into the heart of central Paris. That said, since we were there in August, when Paris really shuts down, we found the neighborhood itself less colorful and lively than, say, the Marais or St. Germaine area. Travelers should also be aware that the hotel is not a five-star property: there are no minibars or kettles in the rooms, the small lift means usually only 2-3 people can go up at once, there's only one computer for public use downstairs (and it always seemed to be occupied), though Wifi is free. The 11 Euro breakfast includes pastries, breads, ham, cheese, yogurt, fruit compote -- and what were supposed to be hard-boiled eggs, but were not! (You can imagine how we discovered this, even after asking). And items were not replenished. When we ate breakfast at 9 a.m., the croissants and bread ran out -- never to be replaced. This was one of the few drawbacks of the hotel. The other is that hotel policy requires guests to leave their key at the front desk, which is manned 24-hours. Once, however, we stood at the reception desk waiting for our key for at least ten minutes while the clerk ( a woman who did not appear to be a regular) spoke on the phone with a potential guest. We're not very picky about service, but her refusal to simply acknowledge that we were waiting struck us as impolite. Otherwise, however, the reception staff was TERRIFIC. We were given an extremely warm welcome and plenty of assistance during our stay. Every time we needed something -- directions, taxi reservations, help with the rooms -- the rest of the staff was friendly, kind, and prompt. We were comfortable at Hotel de l'Empereur, we were well-rested, and we were generally impressed. We would definitely stay there again. Merci beaucoup a tous!

Reviews.Title: “Beutifully decorated, middle of EVERYTHING in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rivergait
Reviews.Content: Stayed here solo a few days before a small group tour through all of France (same hotel), then bookended my trip with an additional few days in Paris. Staff was terrific, breakfasts were terrific, room(s), newly remodeled, were terrific! My upgraded view of L'Invalides was amazing, but even the courtyard vista when with the tour group was fine. The tree-lined location is a block from a major Metro stop, walking distance from Eiffel Tower, clusters of cafes abound. Definitely will be my "next-year Paris" destination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break”
Reviews.Author: Calum86
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four day break in Paris, our first visit to the city and were delighted with the Hotel de L Empereur. The hotel is set on a quiet street less than 200 meters from the nearest Metro station, La Tour Maubourg, located near to Hotel des Invalides and a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. A small hotel, as the other reviews highlight the hotels room standards in my opinion exceeded the current two star grading. We booked a double room with a street view and were delighted with our fourth floor room which afforded a view of Hotel des Invalides and its golden dome, which when illuminated at night was simply stunning. The room was modern and spotless with a modern showeroom. A hairdryer, flat screenTV and safe was provided. The photographs on the Hotel web site and those provided by fellow travellers accurately depict the rooms. On arrival at the hotel the reception staff were helpful and friendly . A buffet breakfast was available in the hotel that was reasonably priced by Paris standards however we opted to eat in one of the many cafes as we travelled through the city. We flew into Charles De Gaulle and took the train and Metro into the city, cost about 18 euro for the both of us. One tip if you have a Blackberry is to down load the Paris Metro app which worked out the shortest and quickest route detailing the stations to change at and connections. This was really helpful and simplified our travel. The ticket machines are in English and one ticket covered both the airport train (RER) and Metro. We also purchased the museum pass that covered all the main attractions buying this at Hotel des Invalides were the queues were the smallest. The Eiffel tower we went up at 11pm again smaller queues. River cruise also recomended. A thing to watch out for is a gold ring con, we came across this twice easy way to avoid it is if anyone offers you a "gold ring" they have "found" simply do as we did and walk away. Paris is a fantasic city and we look forward to going back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in a quiet, well placed neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: gdrvasc
Reviews.Content: Prime locale, 2 blocks from Metro, 2 blocks from Rue Cler. Many reasonable cafes nearby. Staff was not a problem at all. Perhaps not the most outgoing, but very competent and willing to assist. English spoken fairly well, of course they enjoy your effort as speaking french. Neighborhood is quiet, very close to Eiffel Tower, Invalides, not far from Champs (a good 20 min walk through wonderful area). Rooms were great for a Paris hotel at this price point. Fully remodeled bathrooms with lg shower, separate toilet across the room but not an issue. Wall mounted flat screen tv, good wifi access. I would think that most people would find this a pleasant surprise and a fine lodging choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel with in beautiful area of the city”
Reviews.Author: Carolina159
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this charming and newly remodeled hotel with great amenities and prompt service. I stayed at this hotel with my fiance in one room and my parents in another. We stayed at the hotel for 4 days to tour the city before heading to St. Petersburg, Russia for my brother's wedding. The rooms were very clean, chic, and the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms have a rain shower head, large, contemporary sink, and towel warmer. The only small complaint we had was the shower head was very close to the glass shower wall, so it left little room to shower. We were advised to stay off the usual tourist area to save money and to see a different part of the city. We were very happy with our decision since we got the quiet at night, but were still able to walk to all the major tourist attractions. The metro is very close to easily get to other parts of the city and the Eiffel Tower is within a reasonable walking distance. We spent a majority of our time on a great brick street with many indoor/outdoor cafes, fruit and pastry stands, and wine stores which was right around the corner where we drank wine outside and enjoyed great breaksfasts, lunches, and dinners. I would recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Asli-Celebi
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nicely decorated. The hotel is in a very convenient location. It is walking distance to several attraction sigths such as Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees and Orsay Museum. Apart from the staff at the reception desk, who are always on the phone and don't pay any attention to you, the hotel is quiet lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location. We will return!”
Reviews.Author: CZJones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four days at this newly and very nicely re-decorated hotel. Mrs. Pelletier and her staff - from reception to housekeeping, were thoughtful, friendly and very well organized. Breakfasts were very good and well served. The hotel's location is great! The neighborhood is charming, a few blocks from Rue Cler & Rue Dominique and -- to top it all, the hotel is near two subway stops. Can't ask for more. We will definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unfriendly Receptionist - Bad first impression”
Reviews.Author: geramiah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first visit to Paris in June 2011. While the hotel itself was clean and comfortable (small rooms etc. but this is standard in Paris), the first impression given by the Receptionist when we arrived was really terrible. After standing at the counter for at least a minute during which time she never looked up from her reading to acknowledge us, she then raised her head and said 'Oui'. She was cold and unfriendly and did not give us any assistance with features of the hotel (eg. using the room card to activate the lights etc.). The rest of the staff including the owner were OK but ovrall this is an overpriced and unfriendly place to stay - I'm sure there is much better value to be found in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean well-decorated hotel near the Invalides”
Reviews.Author: Pogleswood6
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice bed and breakfast. Beautifully decorated, very clean, and with helpful reception staff. Bathrooms are new, but only have showers (no bath tubs). The hotel is right by the Invalides, and walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Lots of good, not too expansive, restaurants nearby. We booked two adjoining rooms - so lots of space for two parents and two children. However, the little corridor connecting the rooms had a light which does not go out, which disturbed out sleep a bit. Also, go after July 2011 as there are road works right outside from 8am to 5pm at the moment and we were woken by penumatic drills!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel. No triple rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Luizasch
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel if you´re looking for a single or double room nearby interesting sites. I was really disappointed as I mailed twice the hotel, confirming a nice triple room as promissed, and, when we arrived, I had an extra bed, with no moving space at the room, not even to open our lugagge. The gentleman that received us told me it was not Las Vegas, something really impolite! Anyway, they agreed with us, it was not a triple room, so they offered me an extra room for two days, but only for two days, as a favor!!! Ok. This hotel will never be one of my top 10!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Florimond
Reviews.Content: The owner of Le Muguet, diagonally across the street, bought this hotel and did a total room rehab. She gave us a tour of the rooms and we were very impressed. The views are spectacular but the creature comforts are even more important. The showers are worthy of any American bath, the bedrooms are very spacious by Parisian standards, and are beautifully decorated and very clean. We have been long-time customers of Hotel Le Muguet but next year we will stay at L'Empéreur. Either hotel will provide a great Parisian stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: feline2ca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from Les Invalides and steps away from Rue Cler and Rue St. Domique in Paris. A nice hotel with comfortable rooms and clean, modern bathrooms. The staff was cool and distant, but we were told to expect this everywhere in Paris, so we weren't surprised. Free public computer and internet, and air conditioner in room were nice. Breakfast was available for an extra 11 euros, so we opted to go out to the local cafes instead. Great location! Only 10 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, 15 minutes to the Museum D'Orsay, 2 minutes from Napoleon's Tomb and Les Invailes, 20 minutes to the Louvre. Rue Cler is right by with its great restaurants, and shops, and Rue St. Dominque was just north with more restaurants and shops. I couldn't have picked a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: CherylG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de l'Empereur on both ends of our 17 day trip to France. Four days at the start and four days at the end. We enjoyed both stays. The hotel is in a good location. Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler shopping, the Seine and most of the other locations we wanted to go to. The rooms are typically small, but very nicely decorated and comfortable. Bathrooms are a good size and spotless. Our view of Naploleans Tomb was breathtaking. The best part of our stay was meeting Remy at the front desk. He was so helpful and very warm. He helped us plan some of our outings and gave us advice on a few things. We felt we made a friend and he is someone we will fondly remember from our travels in France.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - good location !”
Reviews.Author: ehuygens
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Paris with 17 ladies. We all stayed at the hotel L'Empereur, a small, quiet hotel with nicely decorated/renovated rooms and very clean bathrooms. We appreciated the excellent service !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwork2travel07
Reviews.Content: First of all my wife and I are very discriminating when it comes to hotels, so for us to be very pleased with our accomodations at the Hotel de l'Empereur is significant. The hotel was recently renovated so it is clean and beautifully furnished. We had a large double room with a view and.......oh what a view......it was gorgeous! By both European and American standards the room and bathroom were quite large. Outside noise was non-existent. The walls and windows seemed very soundproof. The only noise would be in the hallway as others opened and closed doors. Besides, the streets around this hotel are not very busy. It is a quiet neighborhood. The bed was quite comfortable and we slept very well. We were across the street from Les Invalides and about 5 blocks from Rue Cler. There are many small cafes and restaurants in the area and even a mini market for bottled water, snacks, sandwiches, sodas or just about anything. The Metro is about 100 yards away which was awesome. From there you can get just about anywhere. It is a 20 to 30 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and great shopping along the way! The hotel offers a continental breakfast for 11 Euros and has a nice seating area. Although we preferred eating at small sidewalk cafes we did eat here twice and it was good, but simple. There is also free wireless internet service throughout the hotel which was extremely nice. For those without wireless devices there is a computer in the lobby. If you look at the room photos at the hotel's website you will see a true representation of what they offer. Being in Paris was incredibly wonderful and we saw and did so much in 5 days. There is still more to do so we will return and will definitely stay at the Hotel de l'Empereur once again. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ** Hotel in Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Ken-Judy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we couldln't have picked a better place to start. Our room was nicely decorated, quiet, and had a comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was spacious and modern with a large shower. We loved the neighborhood which is about a 5 minutes walk to Rue Cler and just a little farther to the Eiffel Tower. The restaurant Pasco across the street from the hotel was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, very clean, beautiful decor!”
Reviews.Author: evilstar
Reviews.Content: Great location! Less than 5 min walk to the metro station, 20 – 25 min walk to Eiffel Tower, 5 min to Dome Church. Rooms – nice, small but cozy, clean, lovely interior. Beds are very comfortable with soft pillows. Air-condition was useful because of the high temp. Bathroom – good size, love the shower with the little stones. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Elevator was quite small – 3 persons only, but still ok. Hotel’s policy is no food or drink in the rooms, but there is tea/coffee available in lobby downstairs. There is also free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: arlett25
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, awesome location... It is walking distance to the Eiffel tower, close to many restaurants, cafe's, etc! You will not be disappointed... Room is very small, but you shouldn't be spending a lot of time in your room ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great and restful hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Petra1710
Reviews.Content: Restful and cosy hotel with very good location - close to metro station and near to Les Invalides and Eiffel Tower (by walk). Clean rooms, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “tiny elevator but large room”
Reviews.Author: meisarah
Reviews.Content: all the service that's given from this hotel is quite nice, you get what you payed for, really near from toue d'eiffel. Excelent room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves higher rating! Convenient, clean, quiet, and modern”
Reviews.Author: DC_girlinLondon
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed in Paris three times in the last six months - Hotel l'Empereur, Hotel Muguet, and Hotel le Bellechasse. All three are in the 7e - and I would recommend all three. I'm perplexed why Muguet is rated so much higher than l'Empereur - they are nearly identical. L'Empereur was 5 euros cheaper, but they are on the same street, similar decor, both quiet, both modern decor, tvs. Actually, I would rate l'Empereur higher than Muguet, because the bedroom and bathroom were bigger, with a rainfall shower, whereas Muguet had a much smaller room and shower. Both had good towels and bedding as well. I can vouch for the air conditioning working well also - it was a record warm temperature for April and the room was cool enough for sleeping. Both are just around the corner from La Tour Mauborg metro station, and also near l'Ecole Militaire station as well. Fun shopping and cafes along Rue Cler as well. my only complaint (and a minor one) is that the shower is one of those that doesn't really have a lip, so the water tends to get on the floor, but that's a very small complaint. (for the record, while la Bellechasse is clearly a notch above these two, it's also 150 euros more a night, and our room only had a hand-held shower). I would save your money and stay here instead. Also - skip the breakfast at all 3 - not worth the money. Buy a pain au chcolate at a local bakery and a piece of fruit instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great but for the lack of a latch on the door”
Reviews.Author: adriennewu
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 4 nights at this little gem of a hotel in Paris. Pictures on their website is representative of what you actually get. So everything is clean and newly renovated with nice decor - no musty frumpy worn furniture here.. We reserved a room with a view of Invalides and it was a lovely sight to behold at night. Our toilet and bathroom (both spacious and modern by Parisian standards!) are separated - which we thought a little weird at first but did work out quite well (women in the morning!). Beds are very comfy! Little hiccups/quirks as per the norm in smaller establishments - but everything works so nothing major to worry about. 24 hour reception - very helpful. You need to leave your card key at the desk when leaving the hotel for the day. Some traffic noise if you have the window open (we were on 2F which is kinda 3F) but sounds peters out as the hotel sits in a quiet neighborhood. Quiet means no action right outside the front door - but Rue Cler is 10 mins walk, cafes are 5 mins walk, Notre Dame is an hour's walk, Champs Elysees a 25 mins walk. We felt that the only real bother was that there isn't a security latch on the door. Otherwise, all cool

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsJAS
Reviews.Content: First of all, we traveled by train, so we have no knowledge about parking. So, with that out of the way, let me say that we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel de l'Empereur very much. The staff was friendly; we had a very nice room, the hotel allowed free Internet access with their computer, we enjoyed the breakfasts. No complaints. We wanted to stay here during our entire trip to Paris but had to change hotels. If there is anything negative to say, it doesn't concern the hotel, but the area. We stayed in this hotel because it was in the area near Rue Cler for two reasons: (1) The Rue Cler is highly recommended by Rick Steves of public television fame; (2) when it was necessary to change hotels, we had to walk only a few blocks. We plan to return to Paris in June and my husband would like to stay at this hotel again. My hesitation is that the Rue Cler is a little out of the way for most tourist destinations. There are shops, restaurants, laundromats you can walk to (very important to us), and friendly staff at the local post office. This area has the Eiffel Tower, Rodin Museum, and Napoleon's Tomb nearby. However, the Metro requires changes to get to the most desired travel destinations and some of the transfers went on and and on down long halls and up stairs, etc. There were times when I felt that I had walked under half of Paris. As I have said, we have no complaints about the hotel. Just an aside: If this is your first trip to Paris, please visit Napoleon's Tomb and the Sainte-Chapelle.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel. Comfy, clean, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: ajay87
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 night / day trip for myself and my Fiancee as a surprise trip in March. I looked around for a while and couldn't decide on a hotel, until i saw this one. This looked perfect - it was. It's a great location in Paris. 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, with some amazing local restaurants, shops and patisseries - Explore the area on the way to the tower and you will find some gems. 10 minute walk the other way and your at the banks of the Seine. With Napoleon's tomb and Invalides close by (with stunning views too), and a metro with great links 2 minute walk away, we found it ideal. It's a quiet area too. The room was lovely. Newly decorated, everything was really nicely finished, and extremely comfortable. I paid for a room with a view, and champagne waiting for us to arrive (30e / bottle) which was there, chilled and ready when we arrived. The view is excellent - worth it for those nights sat with Champagne, or mornings looking out. We we're on the 5th floor and had a small balcony, which doors opened out on too. Perfect to stand and watch the world go by. Room has hairdryer, free safe box, and basic toiletries. The bathroom was spacious with modern fittings, and had a large shower. The beds are large, and very comfortable with extra bedding in wardrobe. We slept extremely well. Heating can be controlled in room with ac, and our room was a good size too (especially for Paris). Wifi is available throughout the hotel for free. You just have to get the password off reception, and get them to set an account up. It was fast, but does require login each time you connect. Reception always helpful. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that. We preferred to wonder down the road and find a local patisserie or cafe. Lift is small but fits three and a suitcase. Coffee and drinks available in the hotel, and our room was fully cleaned every day. We would definitely stay there again. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryoz
Reviews.Content: I just spent the one night here in transit through Paris, but this hotel was perfect. The renovations are beautiful, and the bed was really comfortable. I had a view of Les Invalides which felt so close I could almost touch it! I had an excellent dinner down the Boulevard La Tour Maubourg at Restaurant La Cuisine. Great food, very relaxed friendly staff. My only complaint would be that someone was smoking several times throughout the night, and because I was on the first floor I had noise and smoke drifting under my door. But it certainly didn't put my off coming back - I'd just ask to be placed in a higher floor next time!

Reviews.Title: “Oui Oui; this is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thedoormouse
