Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel l’Empereur for 7 nights during January, 2011 and found the hotel to be in a nice quiet area and to be very pleasant indeed! The hotel is beautifully furnished with gorgeous décor and although our twin did not have ‘a view’, the window onto the courtyard was not an eyesore. Our window was furnished with a sheer drop and a heavy curtain providing more privacy when needed. The beds were extremely comfortable with lovely soft pillows and the hotel had central heating which was just wonderful during our winter stay. The marble tiled bathroom was very spacious, and complete with a towel warming rack and good quality large towels. It was all rather swish really! There was a computer with free internet service in the reception area. Adjoining this area was the breakfast room. We ate breakfast here on two mornings and while it was initially a nice selection to chose from, we found it wasn’t replenished as guests came and went. Consequently it didn’t prove to be good value for money if you weren’t the first guests to dine and so we found ourselves in Rue Cler for breakfast! This little market street a 2 minute walk away, offered us the most delicious pastries and scrumptious breads for a fraction of the cost. The hotel has a strictly no food or drink policy in the rooms, but tea & coffee are available to enjoy in the reception area 24/7. There is a lift but it extremely small. I’m talking two people or one with a suitcase! We opted to use the stairs! The hotel has a metro station close by and it is also within easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. There is also a laundromat at the end of the street which proved to be very handy for us. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and we would definitely stay again, recommending to book ‘room only’ and to opt for breakfast at Rue Cler.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rileychas
Reviews.Content: Arrived by Eurostar and Metro to station just one block from hotel for 5 night stay over new years holidays with wife and college student daughter. We were very pleased with the quality of the hotel and it's convenient location. Easy walk to Rue Cler and Eiffel Tower. Recently renovated, very comfortable bed, quiet location, excellent bathroom. Highly recommended, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated hotel located in a nice neighborhood in Paris”
Reviews.Author: skd1305
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through their sister hotel since it was fully booked and were pleasantly surprised. My husband and I were in France for two months and this was the first hotel we stayed in in Paris and were extremely happy. It is newly renovated with really nice rooms and bathrooms. Rooms are a little small but still a good size by Paris standards. The hotel is a short walk from the Dome Church and Musee Rodin as well as the La Tour Maubourg metro. Our room had a good view of the Dome Chruch and although it was facing the street it was not noisy. The hotel is located in a nice neighborhood with lots of little streets nearby that are fun to explore.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CLJnWC
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through their sister hotel and were more than delighted. Location is great - an easy walk to Rue Clar, Eifel Tower, Napoleon's Tomb, Metro, or even into central Paris. The rooms were very nice, albeit a bit small. The newly renovated hotel made it a gem for the price and location. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dont know why this hotel only has 2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Bartley
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed here for two nights in November, we chose it because of its location, price and the reviews and the Hotel did not disappoint. The room we were given was on the top floor overlooking the courtyard, it was really spacious and also had a large bathroom. The room seemed to be newly decorated and was spotless. The bed was comfortable and there was no external noise. The bathroom was modern and we loved the stone/pebble finish on the shower floor. The staff were helpful with what ever we needed to find, especially in recommending restaurants. I cant see why its only a two star as I've stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels that are not half as good. When we go back to Paris we will definitely stay here again. Thanks, Peter

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tagaroo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! I was going to stay at the Hotel Muguet but it was sold out and I was referred to the Hotel de L'empereur. I am so glad I stayed at this hotel! The reservation process was a breeze and everything was perfect when I checked in! The renovations are SUPERIOR! Really worth every cent! It is a true gem to find a hotel of this quality in Paris so close to everything! I had a gorgeous view of Les Invalides! I was coming to Paris to have a reunion with an old friend of mine...Mme Peletier took our picture for us! Thank you! I will come back again next October! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on, just what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: wfalenta
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel at random from a selection of hotels near the Eiffel Tower. It appealed to me because it had the option of a room with a view. I took my girlfriend for her birthday as a surprise so I wanted something a little bit more special. I requested the hotel to put a bottle of champagne in my room for when we arrive, all via email which was hassle free. The communication was superb. On arrival, the reception gave the impression that some serious money was spent on renovations, and this was confirmed when we saw our room. Spacious enough for a small, city hotel, very modern and finished to a very high standard. The bed was big and the view was magnificent. And the champagne waiting for us was cold! I booked through a third party (comparison website) so originally my room was without a view, but I managed to upgrade with no problems (again via email before my departure). It's location is also very good, with some nice cafes nearby and a nice (not too far) walk to the Eiffel Tower and Seine river, yet not in the crazy commotion of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value,great location,Madame Pelletier & staff gracious”
Reviews.Author: boomer51
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been refurbished with great taste.My wife and I stayed only 3 days and went on to Lyon. We were close to some great restaurants(walking distance) & the Metro.Our room was very quiet,.no problems.On our return to Paris we had tried to book 2 more days at this hotel but they were full.Our stay was in early October, a great time to be in Paris. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends & family. Andy & Leslie, Hanover County, Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: JoJoKen1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after Hotel Muguet was fully booked. for our honeymoon. We had a wonderful room with an amazing view! The room was spacious, and well decorated. The bed was comfortable, and the room was large by Paris standards. The bathroom was beautiful with the rain shower, and the staff were excellent. Also, excellent connection to the tube line, and less than 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and (better still i think) 2 minutes to Rue Cler, which is full of amazinf places to eat and drink. Could not have asked for a better place to stay in Paris, would 100% recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a wonderful location - nice residential area”
Reviews.Author: gmtravellers
Reviews.Content: We were glad we were not turned off with previous reviews about the renovations and decided to stay here - ALL work has been done and everything is beautiful; our room & bathroom were first class - the location for sighseeing & restauants could not be beat. I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected - will be sure to return here”
Reviews.Author: SonomaCountyJill
Reviews.Content: Initially, I had been disappointed that I could not get a reservation at Hotel Muguet but was encouraged to make a reservation at the sister hotel, l'Empereur. I was traveling with a long-time friend and had attended a cooking school in the south of France. We arrived from Provence in the early afternoon to discover a friendly desk clerk who gave us our key to a most wonderful room. I had paid a little extra for a room with a view and what a view it was! We were on the 5th level with a straight-on view of the dome. The room was spotlessly clean, the bed comfortable, with a separate wc from the modern and remodeled bathroom. The decor is chic and the bathroom is well-lit and contemporary. Even the bathroom had a grand view. To have a real shower in France is a treat and this was a rainshower type. The elevator is teeny-tiny but can comfortably handle two/three people or one with luggage. The lobby is simple. We did not take part in having the hotel breakfast but ventured over to nearby Rue Cler for breakfast. The metro is nearby at La Tour Malbourg. The walk to the Eiffel Tower is an easy one. This hotel is well-situated and is in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Well renovated, New ownership, Great Location, Good Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: ruinslover
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's renovation was just completed this Fall and Madame Catherine, who owns another hotel in the area, did an excellent job. Our room had a wonderful view of Invalides, a small balcony, and was tastefully decorated. Although not huge, it was larger than many Paris hotel rooms, and a good value for the area. The room was well organized and had many thoughtful touches, such as heated towel rack and vanity table. I am a light sleeper and had no trouble with noise. The hotel is 2 blocks from Rue Cler, about 7 blocks from the Eiffel Tower, 2 blocks from 2 separate Metro entrances, and near many restaurants. We enjoyed the area of the 7th Arr.

Reviews.Title: “superbly clean and excellent value for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: candyrock
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in their sister hotel Hotel Muguet for 3 nights, I booked my 4th night at Hotel de l'Empereur b/c Hotel Muguet was full. I was pretty satisfied with Hotel Muguet already, the interior was not the newest but it was cozy and warm, and the the night time front desk gentleman was extremely helpful and friendly (he even walk out of the hotel to show us directions) , and the great value of 110 euros a night makes up for it. So I would expect the same level of greatest from their sister hotel hotel de l'Empereur. And I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived! It was beyond my expectations. Everything was newly renovated, including the lobby and front desk. The lighting was great and the room was the cleanest I've stayed in this price range! It was just Excellant! The service was really good also. Considering both hotels were on the same street, it makes the transfer a lot easier!!!!! Location wise, It was really really close to the Metro station Ecole Militaire, only a few stations aways from Opera/madeleine, where all the department stores are. There is also some nearby food shops that opens till late night, so you can always grab a kebab or some fruits from the nearby shop. BONUS: I left some clothes in the last room i stayed in in Hotel Muguet, and the next morning they transfered it to Hotel de Empereur without me asking and gave them back to me at the front desk. Impressive! Overall a very pleasant stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soli-77
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to Paris, arriving September 11th. She had wanted to stay at another hotel recommended by Rick Steeves, but chose Hotel de l'Empereur as the other place was fully booked. I was so happy to be staying there. A friend who lived nearby met our train and accompanied us on the Metro to assure we found the hotel with no problems, and as we were a bit early for check in time, he walked us over to the Champ de Mars and Eiffel Tower which were nearby. A lot of things were nearby, including our Metro station. We loved being so centrally located in town. The staff were absolutely delightful and welcoming and were happy to give advice for shopping and dining. The room was beautiful with a view of the dome of the Invalides, which made my jaw drop when we first entered the room. I was very sorry to leave, as I felt spoiled while we were there. The wi-fi was a little hit and miss in our fourth floor room, but I'm sure it will be remedied. The bath was so sleek and stylish, the beds extremely comfortable and the closet big enough for two chicks. I rarely, if ever, heard other guests in the hallway. One day there was a little disruption in the lobby with construction, but we were out most days trying to see as much of the city as possible. I'm determined to return to Paris and will happily stay here again! Can't recommend them enough!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific New Hotel in the 7th Arr.”
Reviews.Author: MPH
Reviews.Content: The Hotel L'Empereur just finished its complete renovation. It is now owned by Mme. Pelletier who owns the Hotel Muguet on the same block. We had stayed at Muguet several times since 1998 (before it was discovered by the NY Times). We tried to reserve there this trip, but they were fully booked. They suggested we try L'Empereur. We were very pleased with this hotel; the location is between the Eiffel Tower and Invalides. The hotel was beautifully redone, with tasteful furnishings and great bathrooms. The service was wonderful; knowledgeable and willing. The room we had was decent size for Paris and a good value. Our view was of the Dome of the Hotel Invalides (see photos).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcFry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Sept 7-13. All the rooms have been fully renovated and they look great. Definitely nice and clean, and I love the updated bathrooms. Good size bathrooms (did not feel cramped at all), clean, and it had a rain shower. We asked for a 2 twin bed room but they gave us a room with 2 twin beds plus a cot and even then, the room didn't feel cramped. Location is great too. Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, a grocery (carrefour), patisseries, rue cler, the metro bus and taxi stations, and Invalides. Renovations were still being made at the lobby but I can't comment on the noise because I was out during the day. I hope to stay here again next time I'm in Paris (I just hope they don't raise their prices after all the renovations!)

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this gem (in midst of a polishing)”
Reviews.Author: leebids
Reviews.Content: This hotel is being redone by new owners who also run a place a block away. The renovated rooms look fantastic- like something you would expect in a 4 or 5 star boutique hotel. Combined with the view of Invalides from our room, we thought we had wandered into a postcard. Room is typical small Paris size, but the bathrooms were large and showers were great. We booked a "four bedded" room since we were with our two children. Its actually two separate hotel rooms behind one door- one with queen bed and bathroom, the other with two single beds and bathroom. This was perfect for us since it gave us some privacy. It was not just one room with four beds like we got in some other hotels. All the lower floors were torn up and in midst of renovation when we were there. They comped us breakfast at their sister hotel down the street to make up for the noise, but we never actually heard the noise. One downside is that walls are thin- heard the neighbors even if I did not hear the workers on the floors below.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, just renovated”
Reviews.Author: daetime
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Hotel de l'Empereur for two nights because we extended our trip in Paris and our other hotel (just two blocks away) was booked. We had a large, very clean, very quiet (at night) room for three people. It was completely renovated with new decorations, bedding, windows and bathroom, all very nice. Yes construction work was going on but we read about it before we booked and the hotel confirmed that we knew about it before we booked. Fair enough. We were out the door and gone all day anyway. We did not have any issues with workers or the elevator. We could not figure out the AC but decided the temperature was not that bad. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. It is close to Rue Cler and not too far from the metro stop. When renovation is complete it will be a very nice hote.

Reviews.Title: “Small Gem Spectacular view.........”
Reviews.Author: rmhtdl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed of and on at (L'Empereur)for over 20 years,discovered it on the Michelin guide ,and was always amazed by the view on the Invalides out of the windows.On a short stay in Paris this April,(I tought??) we where stranded by the Icelandic volcano,and had to cancel a 10 days trip to Egypt.The hotel was in major remodeling but its New owner, Madame Pelletier,saw to it that the 3 rooms we where ocupying,would remain ours for 10 more days.The 3 top floors where in the advanced stage of a major face lift ,but the warm hospitality of the staff made it totally comfortable.The new Empereur will be very sophisticated,flat TV's pebbles floors and rain shower heads,small suites on each floor and much more.Most of all the view will be there waitingfor the passage of the luky few that go to Paris to be in the real France.

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience ...”
Reviews.Author: bosleyandmillie
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel previously but not for several years. The hotel has always been suitable and quite adequate for our needs - quiet and clean and a great location. On this occasion we were travelling with our son and daughter in law and 3 year old grandson. We specifically choose this hotel as we felt it would be better than others we have stayed at because we had a 3 year old with us. Our flights had taken us across Canada and then transatlantic to Paris. The two nights I had booked at this hotel were to allow us to rest prior to carrying on to the south of France. I had booked on line and by telephone in October 2009. When we arrived at the hotel about 10:00 am he woman at the front desk said " there will be noise from 9 to 12 and 1 to 3, is that okay? Well it wasn't - we had been in transit since 1:00 pm the previous day. We were exhausted from our long flights. We felt we didn't have any choice at that point. The hotel was essentially gutted on all but the top floor and the first floor of rooms. The top floor rooms may all have been finished. Our family's room was on the top floor and it had been redone and was very nice. Their hallway was still in a state of renovations - dusty and looked like work space. The staircase had been stripped of carpet and had not been redone. There didn't appear to be any temporary lighting in the stairwell. At times the construction workers used the elevator to move their equipment. The winch that took construction materials to the upper floors was just outside the window in my room but it didn't really matter as the jack hammers were louder than the noise of the winch. There was major work underway. The woman at the desk identifed herself as the new manager/owner ( she said as of Jan 2010) Later that morning I talked with her - she was completely indifferent - no apologies for the noise nor adjustment to the bill - she just kept repeating that she had told us when we checked in that there would be noise. Perhaps I'm being to naive to suggest that hotel guests should be advised in advance of this type of conditions - or more to the point, I think the hotel should have been closed for the duration of the work. The hotel seemed more like a construction sight with a few rooms than a hotel with "renovations" taking place. After checking in I went for a walk to find alternate accommodation in close proximity but stopped after three hotels as there was nothing available - particularly in our price range. On a couple of other points: the bed in our room had a rubber sheet as the mattress cover. It was noisy and hot to sleep on. We took it off. The bill as presented at check out was 5 Euros higher on one room than what was confirmed by email.That felt like insult to injury. This has since been adjusted. I have been to Paris several times and yes - I often think of my hotel room as a providing a place to sleep while I explore the fabulous city during the day. That being said there is always a day or two of adjustment for jet lag or the need for other quiet time when I expect a hotel room to provide respite during the day. I can't recommend this hotel - I didn't get value for the money and the owner was rude and indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot in Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: Guinett
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris for a week and were so happy to be in this hotel in the Rue Cler neighborhood. The hotel had friendly, helpful staff and our room, while small, was very clean and had a beautiful view of the Dome at Invalides. The area was quiet and within walking distance to markets, cafe's, shops, sites and transportion. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean and friendly hotel in a safe and interesting area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon is the Emperor!”
Reviews.Author: Paris_from_MN
Reviews.Content: Very small room - about 2 feet to walk around 3 sides of bed. Small TV takes up all of the room on the small writing table. Very small armoire for clothes. Big luggage would have been a problem, but we just had small carry-ons (1 each) and each had a backpack. Small, but new and clean bathroom. Bed was rather firm and pillows were not very comfortable, but we got fairly good rest anyway. Great view from our room. Great location near Rue Cler and Napoleon's Tomb (the Emperor that the hotel is named after). Good for the price. Since we went in early April, lows were 40 and highs were 55. No problem with room temperature. Computer in lobby was not working, so walked 1/2 block up street to sister hotel to use theirs. But, it was often busy. Still, we were able to print our boarding passes and check emails.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay there again the next time I'm in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Kvnbnsn
Reviews.Content: For starters, Hotel de l'empereur is just minutes away from two different metro stops so we could quickly drag our suitcases there after an all-night flight before walking around the nearby shops & cafes heading toward the nearby Eiffel Tower. Plus, we took the metro every single day so it saved us tons of time and made it easy to stop for a quick nap or bathroom break. Other positives are: It's extremely quiet. The staff speaks enough English to make communication easy. There's a completely affordable breakfast buffet for the times we just needed a quick bite before starting the day. All you can eat cereals, pastries, croissants, coffee, teas, and juices. Plus, it's blocks away from rue Cler, a cute & quaint little street w/ markets, cafes & shops for everyone. Be sure to grab a wonderful breakfast from Cafe du Marche! The only conceivable downside (as noted in many other reviews) is that the room was small. Not uncomfortably small, but just-enough-room-for-everything small. Our room had a full size bed for 2, closet, night stand, small desk, 2 chairs, & a television, as well as a connected bathroom w/ a toilet, sink, bidet & bathtub w/ sprayer attachment. A perfect place to spend unwind after long treks around the city and take a nice bath to relax. If you're one of those people that likes spending entire days kicking it in your hotel room then this might not be the place for you. But if you're looking for a clean, safe, comfortable, close spot to stay while you spend your time enjoying the city of lights, book a room here while you still can. As an added tip: be sure to buy your Paris Visitor Pass for the Metro on Expedia weeks before you go. It will save you tons of money if you plan to see a lot of the city as well as avoiding language barrier problems. Just print up the voucher and follow the directions. No questions asked. http://bit.ly/7oX7bl

Reviews.Title: “Very good location. Very good relationship between price and quality.”
Reviews.Author: miguikarpin
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good quality-price relation. It is placed next to Les Invalides, and at a 10 minutes walk to the Tour Eiffel (just 5 minutes to the Parc du Champ de Mars), with a metro station (line 8) at a 2-3 minutes walk. The room is a little small, with a double bed, a small desk, two chairs and a small wardrobe. The bathroom was very clean and new (it seemed the kind of a 3 star hotel). The heating of the room was very good, as we had no cold sensation while outside was snowing. The staff were neither friendly nor unfriendly, but we were satisfied with their behaviour, as they always seemed helpful (they let us leave our suitcases in the hotel for some hours after the check-out). We did not have breakfast in the hotel, as we found it to be expensive (10 euros). The overall impression of the hotel is that it was a very well located hotel, clean and not expensive compared with the rest of the hotels round the same zone. If we hat to come back to Paris, we would go the same hotel again with no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: babbington
Reviews.Content: No, the room didn't have a huge HDTV, antique furniture or 300-count sheets, but it was clean, comfortable and pretty good sized for just over 100 Euros. My only large complaint would be the service. When we arrived, the clerk at the front desk could not find any record of our reservation and clearly had no interest whatsoever in finding said reservation. He would have happily turned us out in the street had I not gone to an Internet cafe, tracked down the confirmation e-mail and printed it out. There are other minor issues. The elevator is so small that it struggles to fit both a single person and luggage. The beds feel a bit thin and cheap. It can be a bit noisy if your room overlooks the street (which is why you should ask to overlook the silent courtyard). That said, it's a very solid hotel for the money and it's in a great part of town, right near Les Invalides and just steps away from a Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here many times....never disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Moncherie10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this wonderful little hotel about seven or eight times now and will be going back soon and will certainly stay there again. I have recommended it to several people and they all seem satisfied. The location is perfect and the staff is very accommodating. It is small, it is clean, it is Paris! I love it. Well worht the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a good location”
Reviews.Author: KarenADallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel several times, getting the same double room each time. It's good value for your money and a good central location

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: vivelafrance079
Reviews.Content: It is certainly far from being luxurious, but with air-conditioning and free w-fi, my husband and I opted for the hotel. It is also close to the conference location he was going to. We had no problems with the room. It was what we expected. We were especially impressed with the hotel desk staff, Remy & Sylvie. They are the faces of what France is -- helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay near Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaFamily6
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in Paris! Location is great - very close to the Metro and about a three minute walk to Rue Cler. We are a family of four and our room was right off of the lobby/breakfast room. We didn't have a view to speak of, but it seemed most of the other rooms had a great one. Our room was large by European standards and the bathroom was fantastic! Bath and shower with a separate toilet room. Our room had nice furniture and decor, super clean. Staff was adequate - one very nice clerk, one was decent. Extra charge for internet - expensive. Breakfast looked fine, but we went to Rue Cler each morning instead. We were able to leave our luggage in a closet off of the lobby until the evening when our night train left for Venice. We made our reservation through the automated system on their website. Good value and accommodation for Paris. Neighborhood is my favorite. We had a wonderful time!!

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelnow068
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a group of 4 teenagers and 3 adults and stayed in two very nice rooms our bathrooms had been totally remodeled and were very clean.we got clean towels (not rags as one writer has mentioned) and fresh sheets daily. we were traveling off season and found the hotel staff accomodating. The rooms were small as we had 5 people in a quad room, but we did not spend much time in the room as we were always out enjoying the city. I would not recommend taking the breakfast at 10 euro-with rue cler so close by you might as well walk 5 minutes and eat at one of the wonderful restaurants and enjoy your cafe au lait people watching as the parents walk their school children to school in the morning- you are very close to the metro and buses. fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewcam888
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the third floor and we had a great view of Napoleon's Tomb. The hotel is old and tiny but I found the accommodations to be sufficient. The bathroom and room were clean. We never ate the breakfast since it wasn't included. It is very easy to find a simple shop for a cheap breakfast. The hotel certainly has a great location in Paris which helps it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Small, old and filthy”
Reviews.Author: mauripop
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel because it was the only one in Rick Steve's guidebook that had any availability. I've been to Paris before and I knew what to expect. However the staff was particularly unfriendly, even by Parisian standards. The room was even tinier than expected, the towels were rags, and worse of all the bathroom was filthy and wasn't cleaned even after I asked, both in English and in French. Even though I had booked three nights my wife and I searched for another hotel nearby and fortunately the Derby had a (more expensive) room available where we stayed. The staff there had a totally different (better) attitude and we were very happy we switched hotels. Both are rated two stars in the plaque they have at the door, but there was no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Poor follow through”
Reviews.Author: bluespruce23
Reviews.Content: I had an enjoyable stay at the Hotel de l'Emperuer until my Ipod disappeared from my room. One day after checking out of the hotel, I contacted them, and they said that they in fact have my Ipod and would be willing to send it to my home address. I immediately supplied them all personal information and credit card details, but have not heard from them since. It has been three months now, and needless to say, they have not bothered to follow through with their promise to return the device. So in summary, I cannot recommend this hotel based on the disappointing service they have shown so far. (And note to self--don't take anything like an Ipod on future travel!)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth786
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 6 nights in June. Really good location in Paris, about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, next door to Les Invalides and Tour Maubourg metro stop. Neighborhood nearby includes the Rue Cler street market, lots of cafes, bakeries, grocery stores. We were staying on the 6th floor. Luckily, there is an elevator (very small!). The room was nice, plenty of room, and the bathroom was huge! We chose not to eat breakfast at the hotel (10 Euros) as many nearby cafes had breakfast available for 5 Euros. The staff were pleasant but didn't speak much to us or offer trip / sightseeing suggestions. They did, however, all seem to speak good English, which made us feel much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Agréable”
Reviews.Author: PES389
Reviews.Content: The Hotel L’Empereur is conveniently located in the attractive 7th Arrondissement within quite easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, the River Seine and the major museums. It is within 400 metres of the Tour Mauberg metro station that is a simple metro journey from the Gare du Nord station (line 4 to Strasbourg St. Denis and change to line 8). Tour Mauberg is also direct on line 8 from Opera if you use the Roissybus from Charles de Gaulle airport. The hotel is clean and refurbished in the last couple of years. Our experience indicates that negative reviews of the past refer to the time before/during the renovations and do not reflect the current situation. Our room (No.14) was a smallish double that had a nice view of the Ecole Militaire. It was clean and smartly furnished with a large shower room. If you need space in your hotel room, or are planning an extended stay, you might describe the room as small, as there was no wardrobe (we kept our suitcase in the large bathroom). The hotel operates 4 levels of variable pricing according to the season, which makes it best value off season. It is in the same street as the Hotel Muguet (see our review Feb 2008), which was full for this current visit. L’Empereur was 35 euros cheaper and that difference just about reflects the difference in ambience/quality. The breakfast at 10 euros is varied (yoghurt, fruit, ham, cheese and eggs, as well as the more traditional bread, croissants and cereals) and is taken in a light breakfast room near reception. The management are helpful and speak good English. We took friends to this hotel because our first preference hotel was full and they were not disappointed. We would be happy to stay there again for the weekend as Hotel L’Empereur offers a convenient, reasonably priced hotel from which to explore this popular area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, just renovated”
Reviews.Author: soisy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has just installed air conditioning and is renovating, but it was all good. The staff was welcoming and the rooms, while perhaps small, were just fine. My 2 sons had a room with 2 beds and a huge bathroom; I had a single room with a gorgeous view of Les Invaides (see photo!). Handy to the metro and a very safe area. And a good value!
